messages.content: Comfyui-ergouzi-kaiguan is a mixed group switch kit designed for ComfyUI process designers and players, which allows for one-click control of ignoring and disabling different groups.

To install Comfyui-ergouzi-kaiguan, you need to open the command line terminal, switch to the 'custom_nodes' directory in your ComfyUI, and clone the ergouzi-kaiguan repository using the provided git command.
What is the purpose of the 'Universal switch▶️' node?

The 'Universal switch▶️' node allows users to set switches through the right-click menu tab of the node and select switch schemes for the global node group. When multiple 'Universal switch▶️' nodes are established, only the opened nodes will take effect each time to prevent switch conflicts.
How does the 'All Ignore👁️‍🗨️▶️' node work?
When the 'All Ignore👁️‍🗨️▶️' node is connected to 'ALL🚫👁️‍🗨️', it ignores the group that 'ALL🚫👁️‍🗨️' belongs to. It can connect to multiple 'ALL🚫👁️‍🗨️' nodes to control multiple groups.
What is the function of the 'All Disable🚫' node?
When the 'All Disable🚫' node is connected to 'ALL🚫👁️‍🗨️', it disables the group that 'ALL🚫👁️‍🗨️' belongs to. It can connect to multiple 'ALL🚫👁️‍🗨️' nodes to control multiple groups.
How does the 'Hybrid switch🔃' node work?

When the 'Hybrid switch🔃' node is connected to 'hulue🔃', it ignores the group that 'hulue🔃' belongs to. When connected to 'jin yong🔃', it disables the group that 'jin yong🔃' belongs to. It can connect to multiple 'jin yong🔃' or 'hulue🔃' nodes for mixed control.
What is the purpose of the 'Recursive switching🔀' node?
The 'Recursive switching🔀' node allows users to input N inputs and output the first non-null value. Users can set the number of inputs to switch and record the name of each input point.
